author: rooneg
msg: Provide a more useful error message for the case when we're commiting
something inside a directory that is scheduled for addition.  This
fixes issue #554.
* subversion/include/svn_error_codes.h
(SVN_ERR_CL_COMMIT_IN_ADDED_DIR): new error for when we try to
commit a file inside a directory scheduled for addition.
* subversion/libsvn_client/commit.c
(send_to_repos): if the entry for our base_dir was copied, error out,
because it means we're committing something inside a directory that
was scheduled for addition.
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/commit_tests.py
(commit_in_dir_scheduled_for_addition): new test for the case where
we're commiting a file inside a directory scheduled for addition.
Approved By: gstein

author: gstein
msg: It is possible (due to error) for a txn not to be present. Watch out
for it so that we don't segfault.
* libsvn_repos/reporter.c (svn_repos_finish_report): if there is no
txn, then issue SVN_ERR_REPOS_NO_DATA_FOR_REPORT.
(svn_repos_abort_report): watch out for NULL txn values
* include/svn_error_codes.h (SVN_ERR_REPOS_NO_DATA_FOR_REPORT): new
error code

author: brane
msg: * Makefile.in (check): output 'FAILURE' when a test fails, since we
output 'SUCCESS' when it passes.
Patch by: Garrett Rooney <rooneg@electricjellyfish.net>

author: gstein
msg: Initial work for fetching deltas. Still not enabled, but this lays some
groundwork.
* libsvn_ra_dav/fetch.c (file_read_ctx_t {}): add fields for handling the
Content-Type of the response. we'll be examining that to determine
whether a diff was returned or not
(get_delta_base): new function to return the base (a URL for a
version resource) for a delta
(fetch_file_reader): rearrange some code and add a placeholder for
processing the Content-Type header (which is picked up by the
ne_content_type_handler that was installed on the GET request)
(simple_fetch_file): add some parameters necessary for fetching the
version URL for the copy of the file in the WC. manually construct
and process the GET request, rather than using ne_read_file; this
allows us to attach headers to the request, and to process headers
in the response.
(fetch_file): pass NULL for the new simple_fetch_file() params
(start_element, end_element): pass add'l params to simple_fetch_file()

author: rooneg
msg: Add tests for issues 439 and 440, which were fixed some time ago, but never
had regression tests written for them.  This resolves issue 441.
* build.conf
add an entry for stat_tests.py
* subversion/clients/cmdline/diff_tests.py
(diff_non_version_controlled_file): new test that calls 'svn diff' on a file
that is not under version control.  also add it to the list of tests to run.
* subversion/clients/cmdline/stat_tests.py
new file for tests related to 'svn stat'
(stat_unversioned_file_in_current_dir): test that runs 'svn stat' on an
unversioned file in the current directory.
Approved By: gstein
